channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The safest intersection on Earth (and why half the infrastructure profession hates it)
item.description: Planner vs. Engineer is a well-known professional rivalry in the infrastructure world. The arguments are sometimes friendly, sometimes hostile, someti...

item.title: The Beauty Industry Is Being Dominated by 1 Skin Care Trend and It’s a Natural Alternative to Fillers
item.description: This year, founders across the beauty industry have been riding the skin care craze to a new part of the face.

item.title: Trump proposes $12 billion aid package for farmers hit by his trade war
item.description: President Donald Trump is planning a $12 billion farm aid package, according to a White House official — a boost to farmers who have struggled to sell...

item.title: These vintage-inspired string lights are here to fix the ‘blue’ Christmas problem
item.description: For many who grew up visiting older relatives during the holidays, memories of childhood Christmas are swathed in a warm glow that feels like the call...

item.title: Elon Musk’s Social Media Meltdown Over Being Fined $140 Million Raises Important Questions About Policies on X
item.description: The billionaire sent a barrage of angry posts after a decision regarding his social media platform.

item.title: Congress Asked To Do More To Help Founders Cope With Retail Crime, Gun Violence
item.description: Crime not only scares away customers, but it can also eat away at a founder’s bottom line.

item.title: Parents are sacrificing retirement, taking second jobs, and liquidating investments just to afford college for their kids
item.description: More than 60% of parents say they’re delaying retirement to pay for college.

item.title: Meta battles Mass. in court over allegedly designing apps to be addictive to kids
item.description: Massachusetts’ highest court heard oral arguments Friday in the state’s lawsuit arguing that Meta designed features on Facebook and Instagram to make ...

item.title: Jared Kushner suddenly emerges in the Warner brawl between Paramount and Netflix, backed by Saudi billions and fresh off brokering another megadeal
item.description: Trump’s son-in-law is emerging as a central conduit for Gulf money moving into American media, and they’re backing the Ellisons and Paramount.

item.title: ‘This isn’t what Walt and Roy would have wanted’: Disney fans with disabilities sue over new ride restrictions
item.description: Disney narrowed the scope to guests who “due to a developmental disability such as autism or similar” have difficulties waiting in a long line.

item.title: Prepare Your Business for Higher Microsoft Software Prices
item.description: The tech giant announced new price increases of between 5 percent and 33 percent for its Microsoft 365 and Office suites — the first in four years.

item.title: The Real Cause of Generational Conflict—and How to Fix It
item.description: For the first time in history, six generations are navigating the workplace together, all under one roof. Here’s the root of their clashes.

item.title: Paramount, Netflix spur Wall Street race to win jumbo loan deals
item.description: Loans of this size have been few and far between over the past couple of years amid subdued acquisition activity. But that’s all changed.

item.title: Baby boomers have now ‘gobbled up’ nearly one-third of America’s wealth share, and they’re leaving Gen Z and millennials behind
item.description: American septuagenarians hold more than $85 trillion in assets—by far the most of any generation.

item.title: Meet the new, influencer-stacked Pentagon press corps
item.description: The new Pentagon press corps gathered last week for their first in-person briefing. That’s since almost all credentialed reporters from traditional me...
